author: Richard Barley
title: Can Markets Handle So Much Trouble at Once?
text:
Trouble comes in threes. In isolation, the headwinds facing global markets—fears of a trade war, problems for the highflying tech sector, and central banks tightening policy—could be manageable. Taken together, they spell continued turbulence.

The turnaround in markets has been sharp after January’s bright start. U.S., European and Japanese stocks are all down for the year. Bonds have offered no haven: U.S. Treasurys, investment-grade corporate and high-yield bonds are all sporting negative returns. Emerging markets are...
